articles.content:
Judgment of "Guilty" Passed on Pro-reunification Figure Protested 
    Pyongyang, April 10 (KCNA) -- The Seoul District Court at a trial
reportedly held on April 4 sentenced Ri Jong Rin, former honorary chairman of the South Headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification, to two years in jail, two years' suspension of qualification and three years' stay of execution.
 The judicial authorities had been persecuting Ri since they prosecuted him on charges of "transfer of money, meeting and communication, provision of facility and praise and encouragement," etc. under the draconic "National Security Law."    
 That day civic and social organizations including the headquarters and the Reunification Solidarity held a press conference in font of the court at which they lodged a protest with the judicial authorities against this unwarranted ruling.

Probe into Truth about Tyranny of Pro-U.S. Regime Demanded
    Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification reportedly made public a statement on April 3 demanding a probe into the truth about the tyranny of the pro-U.S. regime which cracked down upon the patriotic resistance at the point of the bayonet. It said the south Korean people should be keenly aware that the spirit of the April 3, 1948, popular resistance should be kept alive in the movement for national independence and reunification.
 The uprising was a patriotic resistance for curbing and frustrating the installing of the treacherous "separate government" by the U.S. imperialists, aggressors, and their puppet Syngman Rhee clique, the statement noted, and continued:    
 The spirit of the resistance has been steadily carried forward to be the idea of "By our nation itself" in the era after the publication of the June 15 joint declaration. The desire of the uprisers massacred by the U.S. and pro-U.S. separatist forces is coming true thanks to the struggle to achieve national independence and build an independent and reunified country through the implementation of the declaration.

articles.title: Japan's Distortion of History Flailed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anti-U.S. Meeting Held in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- The 66th anti-U.S. solidarity meeting was reportedly held in front of the U.S. embassy in Seoul on April 1 under the
sponsorship of the Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration.
 At the meeting its participants bitterly denounced the U.S. for openly committing human traffic and sexual abuses, etc. in gay quarters around the U.S. airforce base in Phyongthaek.    
 In a resolution adopted there they strongly demanded the U.S. forces immediately scrap the "guide book" which unilaterally stipulates "inspection" and "control" over those gay quarters, which foster these crimes, and transfer the jurisdiction over criminals to the south Korean side.

articles.title: Japan's Claim to Tok Islet under Fire
Book "History of Anti-Japanese Armed Struggle" Vol. 8 Published
articles.content:
Japan's Claim to Tok Islet under Fire
    Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- The Federation of Koreans in Australia in a statement on March 25 resolutely denounced Japan's claim to Tok islet as an aggressive provocation infringing upon territorial sovereignty.
 Tok Islet is an inseparable territory of Korea from the historical and geographical point of view and in view of international law and, accordingly, the issue of dominium over the islet is beyond dispute, the statement said, adding: Japan's talk about dominium cannot but be a downright infringement upon the territorial sovereignty of the Korean nation and a grave provocation.    
 Denouncing Japan for historically committing criminal acts against the Korean nation, the statement stressed that they would pool efforts with compatriots in the north and the south and overseas to check and frustrate all the criminal attempts of Japan.

articles.title: SPA Delegation Back Home
DPRK Ambassador to Bulgaria Appointed
articles.content:
SPA Delegation Back Home
    Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly headed by Chairman Choe Thae Bok returned home Saturday after visiting Laos and participating in the 112th general meeting of the Inter-Parliamentary Union held in Philippines.
 The delegation was greeted at the airport by SPA Vice-Chairman Kang Nung Su and Lao Ambassador to the DPRK Chanpheng Sihaphom and Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Wu Donghe.

DPRK Ambassador to Bulgaria Appointed
    Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- Jo Sung Ju was appointed as DPRK ambassador e. p. to Bulgaria, according to a decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK.
